channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report X-2025041069
item.description:
Report X-2025041069

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-12T03:42:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-09
  • City: DANVILLE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING AIR PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWO GLASS BOTTLES OF CIRCUMFERENCE BUFFER B. ONE BOTTLE HAD SHATTERED INSIDE THE PACKAGE COMPLETELY LEAKING THE ENTIRE CONTENTS. THE SECOND BOTTLE REMAINED INTACT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGE. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report E-2025040262
item.description:
Report E-2025040262

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-09T12:25:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-10
  • City: COLONIAL HEIGHTS
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 10, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3265 was drilled into and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) To remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum of product was placed in one (1) 95-gallon overpack.

item.title: Report X-2025040100
item.description:
Report X-2025040100

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-27
  • City: ALEXANDRIA
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the NDVA location a fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered. Inside was two metal cans with positive closure rings. One of the cans spill it's contents inside of the fiberboard box. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2025040057
item.description:
Report E-2025040057

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-26
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While loading freight into trailer material handler discovered a jerrican that was slightly leaking. Further investigation revealed that a nail protruding from the pallet the jerrican was staged on had punctured the bottom of the jerrican contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the punctured jerrican.

item.title: Report E-2025030341
item.description:
Report E-2025030341

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-20
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 3/20/25, at 13:24 hours, an FRA inspector in the CSXT Acca Yard discovered UTLX 630359, a loaded tank car of sodium hydroxide solution, had leaked from manway. The car was isolated and the shipper, Associated Asphalt Inc., was notified via CHEMTREC (report# 2025-0320-00129). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found release was caused one of six manway cover bolts being less than tool tight. Contractor personnel tightened the manway cover bolts and decontaminated the exterior of the car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shipperâ€™s representative- David Taylor (804-704-7242).
